sentence.text: The expression of hepatocyte cell adhesion molecule (cell cycle arrest), a novel tumor suppressor, is frequently downregulated or lost in PCa.

Furthermore, the overexpression of cell cycle arrest induced by transfection with a HepaCAM overexpression vector (Ad-HepaCAM) exerted antitumor effects by decreasing the proliferation, and suppressing the invasion and migration of bicalutamide-resistant (Bica-R) cells and enzalutamide-resistant (Enza-R) cells.
Importantly, we found that the antitumor effects of cell cycle arrest on the resistant cells were associated with the downregulation of Notch signaling.

In this study, we found that the activities of Notch signaling were elevated, while cell cycle arrest expression was decreased in CRPC tissues compared with matched primary prostate cancer (PPC) tissues.
